greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Number of partitions of n into distinct parts greater than 1, with each part divisible by the next.
comment: Number of lone-child-avoiding achiral rooted trees with n + 1 vertices, where a rooted tree is lone-child-avoiding if all terminal subtrees have at least two branches, and achiral if all branches directly under any given vertex are equal. The Matula-Goebel numbers of these trees are given by A331967. - _Gus Wiseman_, Feb 07 2020
link: Alois P. Heinz, Table of n, a(n) for n = 0..10000
Gus Wiseman, Sequences counting series-reduced and lone-child-avoiding trees by number of vertices.
formula: a(0) = 1 and for n>=1, a(n) = Sum_{d|n, d>1} a((n-d)/d).
G.f. A(x) satisfies: A(x) = 1 + x^2*A(x^2) + x^3*A(x^3) + x^4*A(x^4) + ... - _Ilya Gutkovskiy_, May 09 2019
example: The a(36) = 8 lone-child-avoiding achiral rooted trees with 37 vertices:
mathematica: a[0] = 1; a[n_] := a[n] = DivisorSum[n, a[(n-#)/#]&, #>1&]; Table[a[n], {n, 0, 100}] (* _Jean-François Alcover_, Oct 07 2015 *)
xref: Matula-Goebel numbers of these trees are A331967.
Achiral rooted trees are counted by A003238.
results.author: _Max Alekseyev_, Nov 13 2009
